avalancheActivity.comment: A size 2 avalanche fell in Eldborgargil in Bláfjöll on the 26.03 during E winds with snowdrift. Hikers also triggered two smaller slabs in the same area. Small avalanches are widely seen where snow has drifted.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of snow has drifted into western aspects in the mountains for the last days. Unstable wind slabs and cornices are widespread. Natural avalanches have been falling on this layer of drift snow and avalanches can easily be triggered by skiers or hikers in the area.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely in western facing aspects after E snowfall last week and ongoing E winds last days. A lot of snow has drifted and formed thick layers of slabs that can easily be triggered by skiers or hikers. Older snowpack is widely frozen and stiff but faceting was discovered in a weak layer in snowpits from the region on the 26th of March. High load is required in order to trigger an avalanche on this layer however and the faceting is unlikely to develop in the next few days as diurnal temperature fluctuations will propably not reach this deep into the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in most regions and a large remote triggered avalanche released in Héðinsfjörður in Tröllaskagi on Tuesday. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar austlægar áttir og úrkomulaust næstu daga. Dægursveiflur á hita þar sem frostmark gæti náð hátt til fjalla á daginn.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches fell in the region after N-NE blizzard last week but nothing has been reported since.
avalancheActivity.highlights: N and NE snowstorm passed the region in the end of last week and natural avalanches have widely fallen. A lot of snow has drifted into SE - NW aspects and wind slabs are unstable in those aspects. SE winds are still quite strong in the mountains throughout the weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Last week, a lot of snow fell in two consecutive NE blizzards. Unstable wind slabs have widely formed. Snow pits from the region confirm the presence of unstable wind slabs with stiff melt-freeze snow beneath. Weak layers have been detected within new wind drifted snow and older rounded snow from last weeks blizzard. The wind slabs in SE - NW aspects have grown considerably and are still considered unstable. People should avoid steep terrain while the snowpack is still adjusting.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in most regions and a large remote triggered avalanche released in Héðinsfjörður in Tröllaskagi on Tuesday. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA 10-15 m/sek til fjalla en úrkomulaust að mestu á fimmtudag. Bætir lítillega í úrkomu og hvessir með föstudegi og laugardegi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Large avalanche in Héðinsfjöður by remote trigger on March 26th. An avalanche released on the road to Kleifar in Ólafsfjörður and out into the sea on Friday morning. Two major avalanches fell on the road from Dalvík to Ólafsfjörður night before Saturday. Additionally, an avalanche fell on the road to Siglufjörður west of the Strákagöng tunnel and one in Illviðrishnjúkur. Two size 3 and 3.5 avalanches released above Dalvík on the night to Saturday. Avalanches of size 2-3.5 occurred in Ólafsfjörður, specifically in Arnfinnsfjall, Ósbrekkufjall, Auðnahyrna, and Bustabrekkudal released Fri/Sat. A large avalance released in Karlsárdalur on Friday or Saturday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the forecasting area. Unstable windslabs and thick slabs have accumulated in all aspects. Large avalanche remotely triggered in Héðinsfjörður on 26th March. Many natural avalanches released this weekend, human triggered avalanches are likely to occur.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow in the forecasting area after north blizzard on Friday and Saturday, later light snowshowers and drifting snow. Snowpit (Illviðrishnjukur 26.03) showed new snow and windslab on old crust. Bond between new and old snow is rather weak with CT12. Two other snowpits from last few days showed a rather weak bond between windslab and old snow, with faceted snow and depth hoar between layers. Several avalanches released in the area in the last few days and considerable snow available to drift in the coming NA wind this week. Travellers in mountains are advised to be careful as human triggered avalanches area likely.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in most regions and a large remote triggered avalanche released in Héðinsfjörður in Tröllaskagi on Tuesday. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi smá él til fjalla næstu daga og viðvarandi N-NA átt næstu daga og kalt í veðri. Hvessir á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches were seen yesterday. Quite a few avalanches occurred last week, one triggered by snowmobiles.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area. Unstable windslabs could be present, especially on S-erly aspects. Little snow is at lower elevations in the southern part.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow is in the area, especially in the northern part of the area. The new snow will most likely drift to S/SW aspects in the next days. Wind slabs are present under the new snow, especially on southerly aspects after snowfall in north winds on Friday and Saturday. The snowpack is likely layered in most places and some weak layers could be present. Little snow is at lower elevations after periods of thaw, especially in S-Eastfjords.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in most regions and a large remote triggered avalanche released in Héðinsfjörður in Tröllaskagi on Tuesday. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack around the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NA-áttir, víða 8-13 m/s, og él næstu daga. Hlýnar örlítið en áfram frost til fjalla.
